He took it out of his left coat pocket and put it on the table behind him without looking at Dounia. 

“Take it! Hurry!” 

He kept staring stubbornly out the window. Dounia went to the table to grab the key. 

“Hurry! Hurry!” Svidrigaïlov repeated, still not turning or moving. But there was something serious in how he said “hurry.” 

Dounia understood, quickly grabbed the key, unlocked the door, and rushed out of the room. A minute later, she ran out to the canal bank towards X. Bridge, feeling frantic. 

Svidrigaïlov stood at the window for three minutes. Finally, he turned slowly, looked around, and rubbed his forehead. A strange smile twisted his face, a sad and weak smile, full of despair. Blood, which was drying, stained his hand. He looked at it angrily, then wet a towel and cleaned his temple. The revolver that Dounia had thrown away was near the door, and he noticed it. He picked it up and looked at it. It was a small old pocket revolver with three barrels. There were still two bullets and one capsule left in it. He thought for a moment, put the revolver in his pocket, took his hat, and went out.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Svidrigaïlov urges Dounia to take a key and escape, revealing his despair and contemplating the revolver she discarded.
